intro: Dolichopetalum kwangsiense, commonly known as the Guangxi bellflower, is a rare and endemic flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, pale blue to white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within mountainous regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
